name: Khalil Center
mission: Khalil Center provides the following clinical services: 1.
theoryOfChange: Khalil Center utilizes the "Traditional Islamically Integrated Psychotherapy (TIIP) therapeutic framework" as its model of care. This framework integrates professional psychology with Islamic principles, drawing from a 1400-year-old tradition. It addresses critical questions about spirituality and behavior in clinical mental health practice and serves as a framework for integrating contemporary behavioral science into an Islamic framework. The TIIP model emphasizes psychological reconstruction, behavioral reformation, and spiritual elevation.

evaluationSources: Practice-based evidence study published in Spirituality in Clinical Practice
Research published in Journal of Muslim Mental Health

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is high due to the organization's focus on urgent humanitarian mental health needs within the Muslim community and its Zakat-eligible status [2][6]. The mission specifically targets clinical services and community education through a culturally sensitive lens [1][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates a capacity-building approach by delivering psychotherapy sessions and didactic trainings, though the cost per beneficiary is approximately $907.87 [4][5]. Financially, the organization maintains a program expense ratio of 71.2% and reported Total Revenue of $2,272,898 [3].

baseline_narrative.summary: The Khalil Foundation, operating as the Khalil Center, provides clinical mental health services and community education rooted in Islamic theology [1][4]. The organization is recognized as Zakat-eligible, utilizing a specific zakat policy to support eligible beneficiaries in need of psychological care [2][6].

strengths.detail: The organization spends only <cite id="1">$0.01 for every $1 raised</cite>, allowing nearly all donated funds to support core mission activities.
The center has successfully delivered <cite id="5">70,136 psychotherapy sessions</cite>, demonstrating a high volume of direct service delivery to the community.
strengths.point: High Direct Impact through Clinical Care

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="2">verified zakat policy</cite> that supports <cite id="2">eligible beneficiaries (fuqara and masakin)</cite> who cannot afford mental health services.

strengths_deep_dive: The Khalil Center's primary strength lies in its ability to scale specialized mental health services while maintaining financial discipline. With <cite id="1">100% independent board members</cite>, the organization ensures objective oversight of its <cite id="3">$2.27 million budget</cite>. Their impact extends globally through the <cite id="15">International Association of Islamic Psychology</cite>, which they helped establish to standardize the integration of faith and clinical practice. This dual focus on direct service and systemic capacity building is evidenced by their <cite id="5">324 didactic trainings</cite> and the <cite id="4">50 scholarships</cite> provided to future practitioners.
rich_narrative.summary: The Khalil Foundation, operating as the Khalil Center, is a specialized psychological and spiritual wellness center that has been <cite id="1">operating since 2010</cite> to address the mental health needs of the Muslim community. By integrating <cite id="15">Islamic spiritual principles with modern clinical psychology</cite>, the organization provides a unique service model that bridges the gap between traditional religious guidance and professional mental health care. The center's scale is significant, having delivered <cite id="5">70,136 total psychotherapy sessions</cite> and <cite id="5">324 didactic trainings</cite> as of its most recent reporting. Financially, the organization managed <cite id="3">$2,272,898 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year, with a significant portion of its income derived from <cite id="3">$1,476,207 in program service revenue</cite>, indicating a sustainable model of earned income alongside charitable contributions. The organization maintains a <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 71.2%</cite>, ensuring that the majority of funds are directed toward clinical and educational services. Furthermore, the center demonstrates <cite id="1">exceptional fundraising efficiency</cite>, spending only <cite id="1">$0.01 to raise every $1</cite> in donations. Beyond direct clinical care, the Khalil Center serves as an educational hub, having <cite id="4">scheduled 13,065 clinical appointments</cite> in a single year and distributed <cite id="4">50 professional training scholarships</cite> to expand the field of Islamic psychology.
